content: With a view to provide income support to all landholding farmers' families in the country, having cultivable land, the Central Government has implemented a Central Sector Scheme, namely, **"Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)"**.The scheme aims to supplement the financial needs of all landholding farmers' families in procuring various inputs to ensure proper crop health and appropriate yields, commensurate with the anticipated farm income as well as for domestic needs. Under the Scheme an amount of Rs.6000/- per year is released by the Central Government online directly into the bank accounts of the eligible farmers under Direct Benefit Transfer mode, subject to certain exclusions. 3.  Definition of farmer's family    A landholder farmer's family is defined as "a family comprising of husband, wife and minor children who owns cultivable land as per land records of the concerned State/UT". heading: Department Of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare (Dac&Fw),2. Objective And Benefits,1. Scheme
summary: The "Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)" scheme has been implemented by the Central Government to provide income support to all landholding farmers' families in the country. The scheme aims to supplement the financial needs of farmers in procuring various inputs for proper crop health and yields, as well as for domestic needs. Under this scheme, an amount of Rs. 6000 per year is released directly into the bank accounts of eligible farmers under the Direct Benefit Transfer mode, subject to certain exclusions. A landholding farmer's family is defined as comprising of the husband, wife, and minor children who own cultivable land as per land records of the concerned State/UT. Certain categories of beneficiaries of higher economic status, such as institutional landholders, are not eligible for benefits under the scheme.

heading: Department Of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare (Dac&Fw),2. Objective And Benefits
summary: The objective of the Department of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare (Dac&Fw) is to provide financial assistance to farmer families belonging to specific categories, including former and present holders of constitutional posts, serving or retired government officers, and professionals like doctors and engineers. The benefits extend to farmer families meeting the specified criteria, such as former and present Ministers, Members of Parliament, and retired pensioners with a monthly pension of Rs.10,000 or more. Additionally, individuals who paid income tax in the last assessment year are also eligible for the assistance. The scheme aims to support a wide range of individuals and families associated with agriculture and related professions.

heading: Department Of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare (Dac&Fw),5. Methodology For Calculation Of Benefit
summary: Benefit calculation for transfer of ownership of cultivable land between 01.12.2018 and 31.01.2019 involves proportionate installment for the period till 31.03.2019. Successors listed in updated land records are eligible for the scheme, subject to meeting other conditions and exclusion clauses. Clause 5.3 of the Operational Guidelines applies to cases of succession, ensuring proportionate financial benefit transfer to beneficiaries' bank accounts.

summary: States will compile a database of eligible farmer families with their personal and financial details, with responsibility falling on the respective State or UT governments. Assam, Meghalaya, and J&K are exempt from the Aadhaar requirement until 31.3.2021, during which they are expected to complete Aadhaar enrolment. States and UTs must prevent duplicate payments to eligible families and promptly rectify any incorrect or incomplete bank details for beneficiaries.

content: 7.1  There will be stratified review / monitoring mechanism at National, State and District Level. At the National level, the Review Committee will be headed by Cabinet Secretary. The States shall notify the State and District Level Review / Monitoring Committee. 7.2  The States shall also notify State and District Level Grievance Redressal Monitoring Committees for looking into all the grievances related to implementation of the scheme. Any grievances or complaints which are received should be disposed off on merit preferably within two weeks time. 8.  Setting up of Project Monitoring Unit (PMU) 8.1  A Project Monitoring Unit (PMU) at Central level will be set up in the Department of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers Welfare (DAC&FW) in the form of a Society registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860. This PMU shall be tasked with the responsibility of overall monitoring of the scheme and shall be headed by Chief Executive Officer (CEO). PMU shall also undertake publicity campaign (Information, Education and Communication-IEC). 8.2  Each State / UT Government will designate a Nodal Department for implementation of the scheme and coordinating with Central Government with regard to implementation of Income Support Scheme.
heading: Department Of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare (Dac&Fw),7. Review, Monitoring And Grievance Redressal Mechanism
summary: There will be review and monitoring mechanisms at National, State, and District levels, with a committee headed by the Cabinet Secretary at the National level. States will establish Grievance Redressal Monitoring Committees to address grievances related to the scheme, aiming to resolve them within two weeks. Additionally, a Project Monitoring Unit (PMU) will be set up at the Central level under the Department of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers Welfare, responsible for overall monitoring and headed by a Chief Executive Officer. Each State/UT Government will designate a Nodal Department to coordinate with the Central Government for the implementation of the Income Support Scheme.

content: 10.1 The financial benefit of Rs.6000/- per year is to be released to the eligible farmers in three installments of Rs.2000/- each every 4-month / trimester, i.e. April-July, August-November and December-March. 10.2 The Scheme is being implemented through an Aadhaar linked electronic data base containing details of all members of the families of the farmers whose names appear in the land records. For transfer of the financial benefits to the eligible farmers, Aadhaar number shall be collected for all beneficiaries, since payment of all installments pertaining to the trimester December, 2019 - March, 2020 onwards shall be done only on the basis of Aadhaar seeded data base. However, exemption has been to the States of Assam, Meghalaya and Jammu & Kashmir from the requirement of Aadhaar number and Aadhaar seeded database under the scheme till 31.3.2021. In the meantime these States will complete Aadhaar enrolment so that subsequent installments are released on the basis of Aadhaar seeded data only. States / UTs shall ensure that there is no duplication of the payment transferred to eligible families.
heading: Department Of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare (Dac&Fw),10 Modalities For Transfer Of Benefit
summary: Financial benefits of Rs.6000 per year are to be released to eligible farmers in three Rs.2000 installments every 4 months. The scheme is implemented through an Aadhaar linked electronic database containing details of all family members of the farmers in land records. Aadhaar number collection is necessary for all beneficiaries for the transfer of financial benefits, with exemptions for certain states until 31.3.2021. States and Union Territories must prevent duplication of payments to eligible families.

content: 10.3 The funds pertaining to income support benefit as well as administrative charges shall be released from Government of India to the States' designated account / mechanism.  The benefit shall be transferred by Government of India to the beneficiaries through a mechanism wherein district wise beneficiaries' lists shall be certified and uploaded by the States / UTs and the funds will be electronically transferred via State Notional Account [similar to Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MNREGS)] to the beneficiaries' bank accounts on the basis of their account numbers and IFSC codes. However, where the states verify that Aadhaar linked accounts are not the loan accounts of beneficiaries, the Aadhaar linked payment system can be adopted. However, from the December, 2019 - March, 2020 trimester onwards the States shall have to ensure Aadhaar linked bank accounts of the beneficiaries, except in case of Assam, Meghalaya and Jammu & Kashmir, which have been given exemption till the 31st March, 2021. For ease of implementation the States may consider assigning the job of sponsoring bank for the scheme to the same bank being used by concerned State for MGNREGS.
heading: Department Of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare (Dac&Fw),10 Modalities For Transfer Of Benefit

Aadhaar linked accounts will be used for payment, except in cases where states verify that they are not the loan accounts of beneficiaries. States may consider assigning the sponsoring bank for the scheme to the same bank used for MGNREGS for ease of implementation.

content: I.  The Programme Division in the DAC&FW is to issue Sanction Order on the basis  of FTOs received from States / UTs.  II.  The beneficiary account is to be credited periodically after the issuance of the  Sanction Order.  III. The confirmation of credit to the beneficiary account would be received back by  the DAC&FW on the day next to the day of credit to the beneficiary account.  V. heading: Department Of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare (Dac&Fw),B. Union Government:
summary: The DAC&FW Programme Division issues Sanction Orders based on FTOs from States/UTs, with beneficiary accounts being periodically credited thereafter.
